docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. Mail steamer Baltic, from Liverpool, Wednesday, July 27, arrived at this port yesterday, at 1 P. M. The Baltic has a very heavy cargo, and nearly a second cargo had to be refused for want of room. On the 20th, the following notice was posted on Liverpool Exchange:

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE BALTIC. PEACE NEWS CONFIRMED. Austrian Arbitration. RISE IN FRENOH FUNDS. Overland Mail from India-War in Burmah. SPANISH INTRIGUES IN MEXICO. STEADY MARKETS. GREAT BRITAIN. Parliamentary Proceedings--Lord Mayor's Dinner--A Variety of News--The Black Swan--Irish Affairs--The Crops, &c. Debate on Turkish Affairs in the House of Commons, July 22. America and England. IRELAND. FRANCE. The Foreign Correspondents--Affair of the Commune Revolutionaire--Alboui Married. SPAIN. French and Spanish Intrigues for a Mexican Menarchy. PORTUGAL. Apprehensions of Disease in the Vines.. GERMANY. DENMARK. Important Statement. PRUSSIA. AUSTRIA. Austria acting as Medlator In the Turkish Dispute. ITALY. Apprehended Searcity of Grain-The rumored Conspiracy in Lombardy-Fight with Brigands, &c. RUSSIA AND TURKEY. All Quit--Reported Negotiations to Purchase a Mediterranean Port for the United State--The Russioan Doings in the Principalities-Menschik off Repudiated--The Costa Affairs. CAPE OF GOOD HOPE.

docs.snippet: Emergency response planners in New York City -- or anywhere, for that matter -- face the difficult challenge of persuading people to prepare now for a disaster that may not happen soon, or even at all. But the need for readiness is clear. Beyond t...
docs.abstract: Editorial holds Long Island and New York City residents remain woefully unprepared in event of disaster; calls on federal government and Red Cross to coordinate simple message on what vital supplies residents need to stock
docs.lead_paragraph: Emergency response planners in New York City -- or anywhere, for that matter -- face the difficult challenge of persuading people to prepare now for a disaster that may not happen soon, or even at all. But the need for readiness is clear. Beyond the possibility of terrorist attacks, there are other risks -- contagious diseases, chemical accidents or severe hurricanes -- that could endanger or severely disrupt daily life. The state of preparedness among the city's emergency responders has never been better. But the same cannot be said about New Yorkers at large, many of whom could be caught off guard.

docs.snippet: The steamship Colorado, which sailed from Galveston Oct. 7, reached this port yesterday, after having passed through a series of remarkable adventures. She encountered a hurricane off the Florida coast, which Second Officer Frank Kenny, who told t...
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Colorado, which sailed from Galveston Oct. 7, reached this port yesterday, after having passed through a series of remarkable adventures. She encountered a hurricane off the Florida coast, which Second Officer Frank Kenny, who told the story to a reporter for The New-York Times last night, said was the severest he had ever seen.

headline.main: IN THE FURY OF A HURRICANE; STEAMSHIP COLORADO MET THE GREAT SOUTHERN GALE. Forty-eight Hours of Trying Experiences Off the Florida Coast -- Waves Smashed the lifeboats and Flooded the Engine Room -- The Bark Romulus Discovered in Sore Distress -- Last Pound of Coal Burned as the Steamer Reached Her Pier in this City.

docs.snippet: No news has been received of the steamship Alvo. Capt. Low of the Athos believes she is lost. The agents of the Atlas Steamship Line, who have until now remained sanguine as to her eventually turning up, are beginning to lose hope. They still main...
docs.lead_paragraph: No news has been received of the steamship Alvo. Capt. Low of the Athos believes she is lost. The agents of the Atlas Steamship Line, who have until now remained sanguine as to her eventually turning up, are beginning to lose hope. They still maintain the probability that she has broken her machinery and drifted to a port with which there is no telegraphic communication, but this is the only hope they have.

headline.main: THE ALVO PROBABLY LOST.; The Atlas Steamship Line Agents Are Not so Sanguine of the Vessel's Safety.

docs.lead_paragraph: The calamity on the barge Republic at Cold Spring, Aug. 12. 1891, whereby thirteen, persons lost their lives and more than fifty others wore injured, was recalled by a decision handed down yesterday in the United States District Court by Judge Benedict.

headline.main: COLD SPRING VICTIMS WIN.; Damages Against the Myers Excursion Company Not to be Limited.

docs.snippet: Congressman W.C.P. Breckinridge of Kentucky delivered to a large audience in the Strong Place Baptist Church, Brooklyn, last evening, a lecture upon "Southern Problems." The first step in the solution of the race question, Mr. Breckinridge said, w...
docs.lead_paragraph: Congressman W.C.P. Breckinridge of Kentucky delivered to a large audience in the Strong Place Baptist Church, Brooklyn, last evening, a lecture upon "Southern Problems." The first step in the solution of the race question, Mr. Breckinridge said, would be for outsiders to sake their hands from it and leave it to those living among the colored people.

headline.main: THE SOUTHERN PROBLEM.; CONGRESSMAN BRECKINRIDGE BEFORE A BROOKLYN AUDIENCE.
